div.p: TestNG is a testing framework inspired by JUnit and NUnit, but it introduces new functionalities that make it more powerful and easier to use.
More information can be found at TestNG home page.
@PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin calls the TestNG tool via command line and passes the user-provided parameters.
@PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin includes the most important features provided by the TestNG tool, also allows some extra funcionality to make the test more configurable according to specific needs.

ElectricFlow itself provides some advantages like parameters checking, easy functionality selection using only check boxes or radio buttons, hitorical log reports, procedure duration statistics, simple credentials attachment, real time analysis of the log been generated, among others.
This plugin was developed and tested against TestNG version 5.14.6.
IMPORTANT: For all parameter descriptions below, required parameters are shown in bold italics.

This procedure allows the input of all necessary parameters along with some extra of them to make the test more configurable. When the parameters are defined the TestNG test command is created and run into the Commander, displaying at the end the result(s) of it. It displays a summary with the total of test run, the failures and skipped test(s), this is also a link to the specific failed test(s) or the ones that have warnings, to know where and which one failed. It also creates a log file, which contains the output generated by the console.

tr.td: Provide the directory where the testng.xml file is located.(Required)
Provide the Xml or xmls files containing the tests to execute. (Required)
Provide the directory where the testng.jar file is located. (This is the command-line '-classpath' option)(Required)
Provide any options to execute with the testng command.
Provide the directory where TestNG reports will be generated. (This is the command-line '-d' option)
